verbose_text: Clinically, our data suggest that the level of nuclear pSer 784 -VCP, recognized by the cross reacting pSer 137 -Pfn1 antibody, is associated with poor outcome among patients with breast cancer who received genotoxic therapies (cyclophosphamide, methotrexate, 5FU, and anthracyclines) but not among those receiving the ER-antagonist tamoxifen or no adjuvant systemic therapy at all.
